dt: {bc}filled or resounding with or as if with a buzzing sound

dt.t: a town {wi}abuzz{/wi} with anticipation of the big game

shortdef: filled or resounding with or as if with a buzzing sound; especially : filled with talk or excitement

dt: {bc}a power saw with a circular cutting blade {bc}{sx|circular saw||}
{bc}someone or something that presents overwhelming opposition

dt.t: The Buckeyes have been a {wi}buzz saw{/wi} …, winning by an average of 47.7 points in a 4-0 start.

dt: usually used in the phrase {phrase}run/walk into a buzz saw{/phrase}

dt.t: … the organizers {wi}ran into a buzz saw{/wi} of complaints about many of its proposed venues, which had not been vetted with some of the landlords or the public.
They {wi}ran into a buzz saw{/wi} Saturday night against … Kentucky, a loss that likely means a new No. 1 on Monday.
Never before has a president asked a Supreme Court nominee to {wi}walk into a political buzz saw{/wi} quite like this.

shortdef: a power saw with a circular cutting blade : circular saw
someone or something that presents overwhelming opposition —usually used in the phrase run/walk into a buzz saw

dt.t: {it}Give me a buzz{/it} when you get there.
